problems.title: Binary Search (Recursive)
problems.description:
Problem Statement
Implement the recursive Binary Search algorithm to find the index of a target element K in a sorted array of N integers. 

Binary Search works by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half. In the recursive version, the function calls itself with updated boundaries (low and high) until the element is found or the search space becomes empty.

Input Format
- First line: Two space-separated integers N (number of elements) and K (target element).
- Second line: N space-separated integers (sorted in non-decreasing order).

Output Format
- Print the 0-based index of the target element if it is found.
- If the element is not present, print -1.

Example 1
Input:
5 30
10 20 30 40 50

Output:
2

Example 2
Input:
4 100
10 20 30 40

Output:
-1
hintsList: The base case is when low > high, in which case the element is not found.
If arr[mid] == K, return mid. Otherwise, recursively call the function for the left or right half.
